cxro.met5.device.mfdriftmonitor

Interface MfDriftMonitorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Device

    public interface MfDriftMonitorI
extends Device
    Interface for MET5 MF Drift Monitor Controls.

    This describes the interface to the MET5 height sensor and Dmi drift monitor subsystem.

    REVISION NOTES:
    2017-08-03 : Initial.

    • Method Detail

      • monitorStart

        void monitorStart()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Start DriftMonitor updates.

        Except during resets, the HS and DMI are continuously monitored at the HS 1 kHz fixed data rate. However, this method will first set the DMI incremental axis positions to zero, and then initiate updates of the MfDriftData database at 100 Hz.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • monitorStop

        void monitorStop()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Stop DriftMonitor updates.

        This will stop updates of the MfDriftData database. However, this does not stop the continuous monitoring of the HS and DMI data. Data monitoring is only interrupted, briefly, during a reset operation.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • isMonitoring

        boolean isMonitoring()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Test DriftMonitor status.

        Internal scanner is usually in one of two states: IDLE or MONITORING (other states are STARTING and REFERENCING). This method tests is scanner is in MONITORING state.

        Returns:
        true if scanner is monitoring drift.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • getDriftData

        DriftData getDriftData()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Get a copy of the current drift data.

        Get the most recent drift data values, relative to monitorStart() time. This is updated at 10 ms intervals.

        Returns:
        most recent DriftData object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • getSampleData

        SampleData getSampleData()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Get a copy of the next sample data.

        SampleData contains a snapshot of HS and DMI raw data.

        Returns:
        next scanner data sample.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • getSampleDataAvg

        SampleData getSampleDataAvg(int nSamples)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Get averaged sample data.

        Average over the next nSamples samples.

        Parameters:
        nSamples - number of samples for averaging.
        Returns:
        average over the next nSamples samples.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • hsGetCalibrationOffsets

        double[] hsGetCalibrationOffsets()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Get HS channel calibration offsets.

        Such that,

        position[i] = slope[i] * (dos[i] + offset[i])
        Where,
        dos[i] = (raw_T[i] - raw_B[i])/(raw_T[i] + raw_B[i])
        Returns:
        array of channel offset values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • hsGetCalibrationSlopes

        double[] hsGetCalibrationSlopes()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Get HS channel calibration slopes.

        Such that,

        position[i] = slope[i] * (dos[i] + offset[i])
        Where,
        dos[i] = (raw_T[i] - raw_B[i])/(raw_T[i] + raw_B[i])
        Returns:
        array of channel slope values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • hsSetCalibrationOffsets

        void hsSetCalibrationOffsets(double[] offsets)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Set HS channel calibration offsets.

        Such that,

        position[i] = slope[i] * (dos[i] + offset[i])
        Where,
        dos[i] = (raw_T[i] - raw_B[i])/(raw_T[i] + raw_B[i])
        Parameters:
        offsets - array of offset values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • hsSetCalibrationSlopes

        void hsSetCalibrationSlopes(double[] slopes)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Set HS channel calibration slopes.

        Such that,

        position[i] = slope[i] * (dos[i] + offset[i])
        Where,
        dos[i] = (raw_T[i] - raw_B[i])/(raw_T[i] + raw_B[i])
        Parameters:
        slopes - array of slope values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • hsGetPositions

        double[] hsGetPositions(SampleData sample)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Get all channel positions, given single or averaged sample data.
        Parameters:
        sample - single or averaged data sample.
        Returns:
        array of channel position values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • hsGetzPosition

        double hsGetzPosition(SampleData sample)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Get the height sensor Z position, given single or averaged sample data.

        Return units are Angstroms (0.1nm). Zero corresponds to the center of the HS range (i.e. the design focal point).

        Parameters:
        sample - single or averaged data sample.
        Returns:
        zValue in Angstroms (0.1nm).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • dmiResetPosition

        void dmiResetPosition()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Reset DMI position to zero, all axes.

        Does an AXIS_RESET for all DMI axes. This also resets the current axis position to zero.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception

      • dmiGetxyPosition

        double[] dmiGetxyPosition(SampleData sample)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Get XY position for single or average sample data.

        Get the XY drift error in the reticle frame. XY coordinates are rotated 45 degrees relative to DMI axes. This method does rotation and scaling from axis units (1.5 Angstroms).

        Parameters:
        sample - single or averaged data sample.
        Returns:
        XY position, in Angstroms (0.1nm).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - general IO Exception
